{{title}}

Storage is a trivial hook to localStorage. Its benefit comes in the built in fallback to cookies when local storage is unavailable in the "browser"

  • Markup
  • Code
  • Options
Markup is not required for this module as it does not contain a directive.

Markup used in this example:

<div class="row">
    <div class="form-group col-md-3">
        <label>Set Value</label>
        <input type="text" class="form-control" ng-model="storageValue"/>
    </div>
    <div class="col-md-9">
        <label class="empty"></label>
        <button class="btn btn-primary" ng-click="setStorage(storageValue)">Set</button>
    </div>
</div>
<div class="row">
    <div class="col-md-3">
        <label>Get Value</label>
        <input type="text" readonly ng-model="viewStorage" class="form-control"/>
    </div>
    <div class="form-group col-md-9">
        <label class="empty"></label>
        <button class="btn btn-warning" ng-click="getStorage()">Get</button>
    </div>
</div>


            
var storage = $storage( // your storage options );
storage.set('storage', '');
$scope.setStorage = function (v) {
    storage.set('storage', v);
};
$scope.getStorage = function () {
    $scope.viewStorage = storage.get('storage');
};

var defaults = {
    ns: 'app',              // the namespace for saving cookie/localStorage keys.
    cookiePath: '/',        // the path for storing cookies.
    cookieExpiry: 30        // the time in minutes for which cookies expires.
}
